CVE-2021-3006.description: Lack of access control in breed function allows price manipulation, exploited in wild in December 2020 and January 2021.

CVE-2020-35962.description: sellTokenForLRC function lacks access control for fee swapping, allowing price manipulation.

CVE-2018-17111.description: Access control vulnerability in onlyOwner modifier due to incorrect comparison, allowing unrestricted access.

CVE-2021-34273.description: Security flaw in the 'owned' function allows attackers to hijack accounts and arbitrarily increase digital asset supply.

CVE-2021-3004.description: Incorrect calculations in _deposit function allow attackers to obtain more yCREDIT tokens than entitled.

CVE-2020-17753.description: Function addMeByRC allows attackers to transfer an arbitrary amount of tokens to any address.

CVE-2019-15080.description: A typo in the constructor of the Owned contract allows attackers to acquire contract ownership, obtain tokens for free, and perform a DoS attack.

CVE-2019-15079.description: A typo in the constructor allows attackers to acquire tokens for free.

CVE-2019-15078.description: Constructor typo allows attackers to change contract ownership and obtain cryptocurrency for free.

CVE-2018-19834.description: The quaker function does not check caller's identity, allowing attackers to change contract ownership.

CVE-2018-19833.description: The owned function does not check the caller's identity, allowing attackers to change contract ownership.

CVE-2018-19832.description: NETM() function does not check caller's identity, allowing attackers to change contract ownership.

CVE-2018-19831.description: The ToOwner() function does not check the caller's identity, allowing attackers to change contract ownership.

CVE-2018-19830.description: UBSexToken() function does not check caller's identity, allowing attackers to change contract ownership.

CVE-2018-18425.description: doAirdrop function allows the owner to issue arbitrary currency, ignoring the hard cap and devaluing the token.

CVE-2018-17987.description: The determineWinner function uses a specific blockhash for random number generation, allowing an attacker to control the awarding of the prize by being the last to purchase a tile.

CVE-2018-17968.description: Predictable random function in gambling contract allows attackers to manipulate game outcomes.

CVE-2018-17877.description: A lottery smart contract generates a predictable random value via an external contract call. The extcodesize() function was used to prevent a malicious contract, but attackers can bypass it by writing the code in the constructor of their exploit.

CVE-2018-17071.description: Predictable random value in fallback function due to readable variable, allowing attackers to manipulate game outcomes.

CVE-2018-15552.description: PayWinner function generates predictable random value, allowing attackers to always win rewards.

CVE-2018-14715.description: Predictable random numbers in endCoinFlip and throwSlammer functions allow attackers to always win the game.

CVE-2018-14089.description: Incorrect comparison ('<=' instead of '>='), allowing arbitrary transfers in transferFrom function.

CVE-2018-14085.description: Exploit in the sweep function allows modification of the sweeperList to arbitrary values.

CVE-2018-12975.description: The random() function generates a random value with publicly readable variables, allowing attackers to manipulate game outcomes, such as obtaining powerful characters.

CVE-2018-12959.description: The approveAndCall function allows asset theft by transferring all contract balances.

CVE-2018-12885.description: The randMod() function generates a random value with publicly readable variables, allowing attackers to obtain powerful items and rewards.

CVE-2018-12703.description: approveAndCallcode function allows asset theft due to unverified callcode, aka 'evilReflex' issue.

CVE-2018-12702.description: The approveAndCallcode function allows asset theft due to unverified callcode, aka the 'evilReflex' issue.

CVE-2018-12454.description: Predictable random value in _addguess function allows attackers to always win and get rewards.
